Authors:
Janaíne Rossane Araújo Silva_Cabral, Lourdes Regina Lopes
Batista, Jaqueline Figueredo de Oliveira Costa, Edna Peixoto da Rocha
Amorim, Gaus Silvestre Andrade Lima, Iraildes Pereira Assuncao
Title:
SPECIES OF Colletotrichum ASSOCIATED WITH ANTHRACNOSE OF
POMEGRANATE IN BRAZIL
Abstract:
Anthracnose is an important disease of the pomegranate, as
it affects the yield and the quality of the fruits. The present study
aimed to investigate which species of Colletotrichum are associated with
anthracnose disease in pomegranate in the Northeast region of Brazil,
using multilocus phylogenetic analyzes and morpho-cultural
characteristics. From these analyzes, three species belonging to the
Colletotrichum gloeosporioides complex were identified in this study.
This is the first report of C. theobromicola in pomegranate fruit in
Brazil and C. siamense and C. fructicola in the world.
